intro: Dampiera mooreana, commonly known as the Moore's dampiera, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, pale blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are hairy and often have a glandular texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Dampiera mooreana is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
